other_tests.findings: Results of genetic evaluations were all normal, including tests for fragile X and chromosomal microdeletions.
Helen's neurological examination was essentially normal, and a 24-hour EEG showed no findings.

other_tests.procedure_name: developmental assessment (Mullen Scales of Early Learning)
other_tests.findings: At 15 months, scores in nonverbal problem-solving were at the 14-month level, with significant delays in receptive (5-month level) and expressive (9-month level) language. At 23 months, there were encouraging gains in nonverbal cognitive functioning (14-month to 23-month level) but minimal gains in language. At 34 months, minimal overall progress with gains only in the gross motor skills.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Nonverbal cognitive functioning improved between 15 and 23 months but showed minimal progress by 34 months.

other_tests.findings: At 15 months, communication was at the 10-month level, and socialization at 9-month level. Minimal progress was noted at 23 months, and by 34 months, there was no improvement in socialization.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Communication skills declined in the age equivalent scores at 23 months, and minimal gains were noted by 34 months.

other_tests.findings: Following the placement, it was reported that Helen produced a wider range of sounds.
